page.title: 02 FARMING AROUND BURY GREEN
page.content: Around Bury Green hamlet farming is mainly arable or mixed.Holdings are large.Chief crops are barley,wheat, oil-seed rape,potatoes & beans.Hay is used for winter fodder.Sheep are kept at Butler's Hall & pigs at Bury Green. There are some beef cattle but dairying is not important.Growing rape is encouraged by the E.E.C.Farming is highly mechanised & intensive.Machinery includes combine harvesters,tractors, ploughs,sprayers,harrows,seed-drills & rollers.Few workers are necessary except during the harvest. Fields are large,bounded by hedges,post & wire fences or drainage ditches.Some farmers have removed hedges to amalgamate fields making it easier to manoeuvre machinery.Glaxo have an animal research centre with a guard at the gate who refused to answer any questions.
